A sheet product set of identification elements comprising: a first planar identification element including: a planar body having two opposing major sides defining an outer perimeter of the body with length of the major sides exceeding width of the major sides, the body including printing visible on at least one of the two major sides and the body further including an opening extending through the body and the two major sides so as to provide attachment of the body to a key holding member; a magnetic strip on at least one of the two major sides of the body; and at least one unique code on at least a first of the two major sides of the body uniquely identifying the element from other elements having at least some of the same printing and having codes different from the at least one code, the at least one code being located on the first major side generally along a first outer perimeter edge of the body, between the first outer perimeter edge and the opening, the code being readable by swiping the code and first outer perimeter edge of the body through a swipe reader machine capable of reading the unique code; and a second planar identification element releasably joined together with at least the first planar identification element in the sheet product set of identification elements, the second identification element also including the at least one unique code, the sheet product set including a flexible sheet material core and a first flexible material sheet covering permanently applied to a first major side of the sheet material core, each of the first identification element and the releasably joined second identification element including separate portions of a single piece of the sheet material core defining the core of the sheet product.

2. The sheet product set of claim 1 wherein the first identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering, and wherein each of the first identification element and the second identification element is formed by scoring through at least the single piece of the sheet material core and the single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering.

3. The sheet product set of claim 2 wherein the first identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a single piece of a second flexible planar material sheet covering permanently applied to a second major side of the core material sheet.
4. The sheet product set of claim 3 wherein each of the first identification element and the second identification element includes printing on each of the two major sides of each element.

5. The sheet product set of claim 4 wherein the printing on the two major sides of each element is on the sheet material core in each element and wherein each of the first and second sheet coverings is sufficiently transparent to read the printing on the sheet material core through the first and second sheet coverings.
6. The sheet product of claim 5 wherein the opening is a hole with a closed perimeter.
7. The sheet product set of claim 1 wherein the second identification element releasably joined with the first identification element is larger in size than the first identification element.

8. The sheet product set of claim 1 wherein the second identification element has a body, an opening through the body, a magnetic strip and a code that are identical to the body, the opening, the magnetic strip and the at least one unique code of the first identification element.

9. The sheet product set of claim 1 wherein the first identification element and the releasably joined second identification element together define a composite element generally rectangular in shape and having a size of about two and one-eighth inches by three and three-eighths inches.
10. The identification element of claim 1 in combination with a carrier sheet onto which the element is tipped.

11. A sheet product set of identification elements comprising: a first planar identification element including a planar body having two opposing major sides defining an outer perimeter of the body with length of the major sides exceeding width of the major sides, the outer perimeter being asymmetric in shape, the body including printing visible on at least one of the two major planar sides; and at least one unique code on at least a first of the two major sides of the body, the code uniquely identifying the element from other elements having at least some of the same printing and the asymmetric shape, the code being located on the first major side proximal a first outer perimeter edge of the body so as to be readable by swiping the code and first outer perimeter edge of the body through a swipe reader machine capable of reading the unique code; and a second planar identification element releasably joined together with at least the first planar identification element in the sheet product set of identification elements, the second identification element also including the at least one unique code, the sheet product set including a flexible sheet material core and a first flexible material sheet covering permanently applied to a first major side of the sheet material core, each of the first identification element and the releasably joined second identification element including separate portions of a single piece of the sheet material core defining the core of the sheet product set.

12. The sheet product of claim 11 wherein the first identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering and wherein each of the first identification element and the second identification element is formed by scoring through at least the single piece of sheet material core and the single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering.

13. The sheet product of claim 12 wherein the first identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a single flexible planar material sheet covering permanently applied to a second major side of the core material sheet.

14. The sheet product of claim 13 wherein the second planar identification element has a body with two major planar sides and further including printing on each of the two major planar sides of the first and second identification elements.
15. The sheet product of claim 14 wherein each of the first identification element and the second identification element includes printing on two major sides of the core.
16. The sheet product of claim 11 wherein the second identification element releasably joined with the first identification element is larger in size than the first identification element.

17. The sheet product of claim 11 wherein the second identification element has an asymmetrically shaped body, an opening through the body and a unique code identical to the asymmetrically shaped body, the opening and the unique code of the first identification element.

18. The sheet product of claim 11 wherein the first identification element and the releasably joined second identification element together define a composite element generally rectangular in shape and having a size of about two and one-eighth by three and three-eighths inches.

19. A planar identification element comprising: a planar body having two opposing major sides defining an outer perimeter of the body with length of the major sides exceeding width of the major sides, the outer perimeter being asymmetric in shape, the body including printing visible on at least one of the two major planar sides; and at least one unique code on at least a first of the two major sides of the body, the code uniquely identifying the element from other elements having at least some of the same printing and the asymmetric shape, the code being located on the first major side proximal a first outer perimeter edge of the body so as to be readable by swiping the code and first outer perimeter edge of the body through a swipe reader machine capable of reading the unique code; wherein the planar body has therethrough an opening located at least one inch away from the first perimeter edge.

21. The printed sheet product of claim 20 wherein the first identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering.

22. The printed sheet product of claim 21 wherein the first identification element and the second planar identification element are further formed by separate portions of a single piece of a second flexible planar material sheet covering permanently applied to a second major side of the core material sheet.
23. The printed sheet product of claim 22 further including printing on each of two major sides of the core material sheet.
24. The printed sheet product of claim 22 further including printing on each of the two major sides of each of the first identification element and the second identification element.
25. The printed sheet product of claim 22 further including printing on a second remaining side of the body.

26. The printed sheet product of claim 20 wherein the second identification element has a body, an opening through the body and a unique code identical to the body, the opening, and the unique code of the first identification element.
28. The printed sheet product of claim 27 wherein the unique code is visibly printed on the first side of the body between the opening and the first outer perimeter edge.

29. The printed sheet product set of claim 20 wherein at least some of the printing on each of the first and second planar identification elements is on the sheet material core in each element and wherein the first sheet covering is sufficiently transparent to read any printing on the sheet material core beneath the first sheet covering.
30. The printed sheet product of claim 29 wherein the opening is a hole with a closed perimeter.

32. A sheet product set of identification elements comprising: a first identification element of the sheet product set including a planar body having two opposing major sides defining an outer perimeter of the body with length of the major sides exceeding width of the major sides, the outer perimeter being asymmetric in shape, the body including printing visible on at least one of the two major planar sides; and a magnetic strip on at least one of the two major sides of the body along a first outer perimeter edge of the body such that both the magnetic strip and the first outer perimeter edge can be passed through a magnetic stripe swipe reader to read data on the strip; and and a second identification element releasably joined together with at least the first identification element in the sheet product set, the second identification element also including a body having two opposing major sides and a code unique to the sheet product set on at least one of the major sides, the sheet product set including a flexible sheet material core and a first flexible material sheet covering permanently applied to a first major side of the sheet material core, each of the first identification element and the releasably joined second identification element including separate portions of a single piece of the sheet material core defining the core of the sheet product set.

33. The sheet product set of claim 32 wherein the first identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering and wherein each of the first identification element and the second identification element is formed by scoring through at least the single piece of sheet material core and the single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering.

34. The sheet product set of claim 33 wherein the first identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a second, single piece of flexible planar material sheet covering permanently applied to a second major side of the core material sheet and wherein the scoring extends through the second piece of flexible planar material sheet.
35. The sheet product set of claim 34 further including printing on a remaining one of the two major planar sides of at least the first identification element.
36. The sheet product set of claim 32 wherein the second identification element has an asymmetrically shaped body identical to the asymmetrically shaped body of the first identification element.
37. The sheet product set of claim 36 wherein each of the first and second identification elements has a closed perimeter hole extending through the body thereof.
38. The sheet product set of claim 32 wherein at least the first identification element has an opening therethrough so as to permit attachment of the first identification element to a key holder.
39. The sheet product set of claim 38 wherein the opening has a closed perimeter.

40. The sheet product set of claim 38 wherein the first identification element and the releasably joined second identification element together define a composite element generally rectangular in shape and having a size of about two and one-eighth by three and three-eighths inches.

41. The sheet product set of claim 32 wherein the first identification element and the releasably joined second identification element together define a composite element generally rectangular in shape and having a size of about two and one-eighth by three and three-eighths inches.

42. A planar identification element comprising: a planar body having two opposing major sides defining an outer perimeter of the body with length of the major sides exceeding width of the major sides, the outer perimeter being asymmetric in shape, the body including printing visible on at least one of the two major planar sides; and a magnetic strip on at least one of the two major sides of the body along a first outer perimeter edge of the body such that both the magnetic strip and the first outer perimeter edge can be passed through a magnetic stripe swipe reader to read data on the strip; wherein the magnetic strip lies between the first outer perimeter edge and an opening through the body, the opening permitting attachment of the identification element to a key holding member; and wherein the opening is located at least one inch away from the first outer perimeter edge.

43. A printed sheet product comprising: a first planar identification element having a planar body having two opposing major sides defining an outer perimeter of the body with length of the major sides exceeding width of the major sides, the body including printing visible on at least one of the two major planar sides; a magnetic strip extending along one of the two major sides of the planar body; an opening extending through the body and the two major sides so as to permit an attachment of the body to a key holder; and at least one unique identifier on at least one of the two major sides of the body to distinguish the printed sheet product from other printed sheet products in a collection of such printed sheet products all having the same size, shape and opening; and a second identification element releasably joined together with at least the planar identification element in the sheet product set of identification elements, the second identification element also including two opposing major sides and the unique identifier on at least one major side of the second identification element, the sheet product set including a flexible sheet material core and a first flexible material sheet covering permanently applied to a first major side of the sheet material core, each of the planar identification element and the releasably joined second identification element including separate portions of a single piece of the sheet material core defining the core of the sheet product set.

44. The printed sheet product of claim 43 wherein the planar identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering and wherein each of the planar identification element and the second identification element and the opening of the planar identification element is formed by scoring through at least the single piece of sheet material core and the single piece of the first flexible material sheet covering.

45. The printed sheet product of claim 44 wherein the planar identification element and the second identification element are further formed by separate portions of a second, single piece of flexible planar material sheet covering permanently applied to a second major side of the core material sheet and wherein the scoring extends through the second piece of flexible planar material sheet.
46. The printed sheet product of claim 45 further including printing on each of the two major planar sides of each of the planar identification element and the second identification element.
47. The printed sheet product of claim 43 wherein the outer perimeter of the body of the planar identification element is asymmetrically shaped.

48. The printed sheet product of claim 47 wherein the second identification element has an asymmetrically shaped body outer perimeter identical to the asymmetrically shaped outer perimeter of the body of the planar identification element.

49. The printed sheet product of claim 43 wherein the opening through the planar identification element is a hole having a closed perimeter extending through the body of the planar identification element.

50. The printed sheet product of claim 43 wherein the second planar identification element further includes a second magnetic strip along one of the two major sides of the second planar identification element.
51. The printed sheet product of claim 43 wherein the unique identifier is at least a unique code printed on at least one major side of at least the planar identification element.

52. The printed sheet product of claim 51 wherein the unique code is printed on the second identification element and wherein the unique code of the printed sheet product is unique with respect to all other printed sheet products in a collection of such printed sheet products.

53. The printed sheet product of claim 43 wherein the planar identification element and the releasably joined second identification element together define a composite element generally rectangular in shape and having a size of about two and one-eighth by three and three-eighths inches.

54. The sheet product set of identification elements of claim 1 wherein the first outer perimeter edge of the body is also a first outer perimeter edge of the first planar identification element and wherein the magnetic strip extends generally proximal to and along the first outer perimeter edge of the body and of the first planar identification element and is encoded with the at least one unique code.

55. The sheet product set of claim 54 wherein the second planar identification element further includes a second magnetic strip along one of the two major sides of the second planar identification element.

56. The sheet product set of claim 11 wherein the first outer perimeter edge of the body is also a first outer perimeter edge of the first planar identification element and wherein the magnetic strip extends generally proximal to and along the first outer perimeter edge of the body and of the first planar identification element and is encoded with the at least one unique code.

57. The sheet product set of claim 56 wherein the second planar identification element further includes a second magnetic strip along one of the two major sides of the second planar identification element.

58. The printed sheet product of claim 20 wherein the first outer perimeter edge of the body is also a first outer perimeter edge of the first planar identification element and wherein the magnetic strip extends generally proximal to and along the first outer perimeter edge of the body and of the first planar identification element and is encoded with the at least one unique code.

59. The printed sheet product of claim 58 wherein the second planar identification element further includes a second magnetic strip along one of the two major sides of the second planar identification element.

60. The printed sheet product set of claim 32 wherein the first outer perimeter edge of the planar body is also a first outer perimeter edge of the first identification element and wherein the magnetic strip extends generally proximal to and along the first outer perimeter edge of the planar body and of the first identification element and is encoded with the at least one unique code.
61. The sheet product set of claim 60 wherein the second identification element further includes a second magnetic strip along one of the two major sides of the second identification element.

62. The printed sheet product of claim 50 wherein the outer perimeter of the body has a first outer perimeter edge also being a first outer perimeter edge of the planar identification element and wherein the magnetic strip extends generally proximal to and along the first outer perimeter edge of the body and of the planar identification element and is encoded with the at least one unique identifier.
